entry.title: Balancing an American upbringing with Armenian roots

media:group.media:title: Balancing an American upbringing with Armenian roots
media:group.media:description:
Araksya Karapetyan, an anchor of Good Day LA on the FOX 11 channel, gives insight on how the diaspora experience is a balancing act between an American upbringing and Armenian roots. Arakysa talks about the changing nature of the Armenian community in the US and the challenges of bringing up Armenian children as a diasporan.

entry.title: Mobilizing the diaspora to support injured Armenian servicemen

media:group.media:title: Mobilizing the diaspora to support injured Armenian servicemen
media:group.media:description:
Sona Baghdasaryan, the outreach and development manager at the Insurance Foundation for Servicemen, talks to CivilNet about the foundation‚Äôs recent outreach tour in the United States. Ms. Baghdasaryan discusses how the foundation‚Äôs workload and focus has changed since the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war.

entry.title: Artbox - A new project for Armenian artists

media:group.media:title: Artbox - A new project for Armenian artists
media:group.media:description:
Anush Ter-Khachatryan, the Director of Programs at Creative Armenia, talks to CivilNet‚Äôs Emilio Cricchio about the organization‚Äôs latest project called Artbox. Ter-Khachatryan discusses how exactly the project works, and why it will benefit local artists. She also talks about the ways in which Armenia‚Äôs art sector can benefit the country‚Äôs overall economy.
